p: A third group that was established was the Independent Monitoring Board (IMB). While this group is funded out of the GPEI budget, it operates independently and issues regular reports with very candid assessments of GPEI's progress toward eradicating polio and advises on changes that the program needs to make. While the IMB has been a big improvement in transparency and independence in the polio governance landscape, its mandate is limited only to certain GPEI activities. Moreover, it has no authority to make changes and only provides recommendations.
